title: How to Get Rid of Meta AI on Facebook

steps.title: The Meta AI chatbot can be muted.
steps.content: The Meta AI chatbot can be muted. While you can't completely disable the Meta AI chatbot, you can mute it so it's less intrusive while you're using Facebook. Here's how to do it: [1] X Research source Tap the blue circle near the top of the screen, between the plus button and Messenger button. Tap the blue arrow in the upper-right corner of the screen. Tap the blue "i" icon in the upper-right corner of the screen. Select Mute . Choose Until I change it to mute the Meta AI chatbot indefinitely.

steps.title: United States
steps.content: United States There is no way to opt out of Meta AI in the US. Since the US doesn't have strict data protection laws like the EU and the UK, Instagram will not let you opt out of Meta AI. According to Meta's generative AI policy, Meta can use any publicly posted information (including posts and photos) to train Meta AI. [2] X Research source There are a few workarounds to keep your information away from Meta AI: The best way to ensure your data won't be used to train Meta AI is to set your profile to private. [3] X Research source The downsides to this are that your past public data is still fair game, and if someone shares your data publicly, it can be used by Meta AI. Another workaround that may or may not work is to submit a Data Subject Rights form to Meta. To do this, go to this form and fill it out with as much information as you can or want to provide. Filling out this form may or may not help, as Facebook uses local jurisdiction to make a decision for each request, and your data isn't protected as strictly in the US.

steps.title: Europe
steps.content: Europe Open the Meta Privacy Center on Facebook, then go to Data settings > Off-Facebook activity > Manage your data , then turn off data sharing and A.I. model training . Go to Meta's opt out form. In the Manage your data menu, click on G.D.P.R. settings > Exercise my rights . Fill out the form with your information. In the section where Meta asks why their data processing affects you, write that you are exercising your right under data protection laws to object. [4] X Research source Submit the form. You should get an email a few moments after submitting the form to confirm that your request was successful.

steps.title: Elsewhere
steps.content: Elsewhere Check the privacy center on Facebook. Each country or region will have different data protection laws. To see if you are able to opt out of Meta AI on Facebook where you live, go to the privacy center in the Facebook app to see if you're eligible to object to your data being scraped for AI. To get to the privacy center, go to your profile, tap the three-line button in the upper-right corner, then scroll down to find Privacy Center . If you cannot opt out of Meta AI, consider following the workarounds above to keep your data away from Meta AI.

steps.title: Open Facebook's settings on the website.
steps.content: Open Facebook's settings on the website. To do this, click your profile picture in the upper-right corner, then click Settings & privacy > Settings .

steps.title: Navigate to Audience & visibility > Posts.
steps.content: Navigate to Audience & visibility > Posts . All of your post settings will appear in this menu.

steps.title: Toggle off Show comment summaries on posts.
steps.content: Toggle off Show comment summaries on posts . This will disable the Meta AI comment summaries on posts on the website and on the app. [5] X Research source Looking for more tips and tricks?
